## ~/repos/github/g0t4/private-auto-edit-suggests/auto_edit/new_silence/detects/time_series.py:6-63
@dataclass
class TimeSeries:
    """Key purpose is to store a sequence of sampled values aligned with timestamps.

    Also, to support common calculations such as diff, smooth, sign, and stepped with transparent and consistent values and times.
    And, some common plot operations to quickly visualize sequences.

    This helps avoid an explosion of two variables _values/_times for every intermediate series!
    And, you can pass both values/times as a single unit.
    """
    values: np.ndarray
    times: np.ndarray

    def copy_values(self):
        return TimeSeries(values=self.values.copy(), times=self.times)

    def plot(self, shift: float | int | None = None, label_end: str | None = None, **kwargs) -> list[Line2D]:
        return plot(self.times, self.values, shift=shift, label_end=label_end, **kwargs)

    def plot_sign_and_smooth_sign(self, shift, color, label_end):
        self.sign().plot(color=color, linewidth=1, shift=shift, label_end=label_end)
        self.smooth().sign().plot(color="black", linewidth=1, shift=shift)

    def smooth(self, size: int = 25) -> "TimeSeries":
        return TimeSeries(values=uniform_filter1d(self.values, size=size), times=self.times)

    def sign(self) -> "TimeSeries":
        return TimeSeries(values=np.sign(self.values), times=self.times)

    def stepped(self, step_size=2) -> "TimeSeries":
        return TimeSeries(
            values=self.values[::step_size],
            times=self.times[::step_size],
        )

    def diff(self, align: str = "right") -> "TimeSeries":
        """Return the first‑order difference.

        ``align`` determines how timestamps are generated:
        * ``"right"`` (default) – timestamps correspond to the right sample of the
          pair, matching the historic behaviour.
        * ``"mid"`` – timestamps are placed at the midpoint between the two
          samples used to compute each difference.
        """
        values = np.diff(self.values)
        if align == "mid":
            times = 0.5 * (self.times[1:] + self.times[:-1])
        else:  # right‑aligned fallback
            times = self.times[1:]
        return TimeSeries(values=values, times=times)

    def mark_rejected(self, why: str):
        text_label(
            x_pos=self.times[len(self.times) // 2],
            y_pos=self.values.max() + 3,
            text=why,
        )
        self.plot(color="pink", linewidth=1)
